Due to its location, menu translated into 7 languages, and not to mention paellas that are reviewed well, "Set Portes" is bounding with tourists, but that doesn't mean they serve tired fun-of-the-mill food. Yes, reservations are recommended, or else you can stand on a line for half an hour. We tried the paella parellada (21.90€), cassoleta de muscles al vapor (10.60€), crèma catalana (6.70€). I haven't had many paellas to compare theirs against, but the serving was yummy and proportionate for two people (though I would've wanted more seafood in it). I'm not familiar with local dining customs, but they billed us 2.40€ per person for the bread that they automatically gave us for starters... seems like a lot for bread.
